basics.name: Daniel Branysh
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior Software Engineer with a strong focus on distributed systems, Kubernetes, and cloud-native development. Passionate about building high-throughput, scalable microservices and mentoring teams to deliver impactful solutions.

awards.title: Hackathon Finalist
awards.summary: Led a team of 5 engineers to 4th place (out of 27) at American Airlines Hackathon, prototyping a logging overhead service using internal APIs.

work.summary: Delivered high-throughput asynchronous systems and optimized cloud infrastructure to support 100K+ daily transactions.
work.name: American Airlines
highlights: Built AAQUILA platform using React, Kafka/RabbitMQ, processing 100K+ transactions/day across 7 microservices.
Reduced pod memory by 45% via AKS tuning informed by ADX telemetry data.
Automated reconciliation pipelines, decreasing manual security ops by 22%.
Launched mentorship initiative improving junior ramp-up by 40% and sprint velocity by 25%.

work.summary: Led modernization of legacy ticketing systems and introduced event-driven architecture for improved scalability.
work.name: American Airlines
highlights: Migrated legacy ticketing to Spring Boot microservices, improving uptime/latency by 80%.
Deployed RabbitMQ event queues, offloading 50K+ daily transactions.
Integrated Prometheus custom metrics with HPAs for traffic resilience.
Cut MTTD/MTTR by 45% using Grafana dashboards and ADX live alerts.

projects.description: Enterprise-grade message orchestrator with NLP input, supporting microservice-based re-platforming of legacy flows.
projects.name: AAQUILA

projects.description: Anomaly-based intrusion detection model for IoT edge devices, enabling real-time threat detection with <5% resource overhead.
projects.name: Lightweight IoT IDS
